LOL I meant so kind of you to offer KEN. Works rotting my brain LOL, sorry was a long day and I was tired. 
   
  I looked up this parts pic and I'm trying to understand how that gets turned into a mic. You wire the mic jack to it somehow to plug it in? I get a good discount at the radio shack here so thats no problem. 

  I also ran across something about using your pc usb as a reciever for AM radio frequency.
   
  Ok off to work again. I'll try and check back later =)
   
  Misty
kenneth b thomas <kennnthomas2000@...> wrote:
          i just got my first clear voice on a digital recorder a cheap 
chinese one from the drugstore. the more times i played it the 
clearer it got UNTIL i turned the recorder off prior to transferring 
to computer. probably whatever biases the flash memory isnt quite up 
to what it should be.

on 1n34 "conditioned" diode; this is one of many things i use to test 
for extremely low level non-randomness in noise floor.

ordinarily, i am literally bedevilled by "angels" trying to speak 
into receiver. gradually i am establishing that a principle 
called "giant negentropy" may be partly due to the efforts of living 
or once living entities from multiple "elsewheres" trying to cohere 
or phase-align noise --which is basically what all life does anyway, 
we increase the sun's entropy and temporarily reverse our local 
entropy.

duh

in english:

life, including life that we cant presently comprehend , like trevor 
constable's sky creatures or the "rods" or remnant cast-off shells 
of human souls may be hard wired to alter its environment thereby 
having a microscopic modulating effect on the local physical laws and 
constants.

it only SOUNDS esoteric; you already know it.

i can make some extra 1n34 diodes for unusual recording opportunities 
i expect first week of april but i need an address to send them to.

i run a bunch of yahoo groups of my own and i know that it 
isnthealthy to start sending home addresses back and forth so maybe 
one brave foolcan volunteer.

kthomas

&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Amy Raiola" 
<SIParanormalSociety@...> wrote:
>
> LOL!! Misty, I didn't want to be the one to say it, but I feel the 
same way!! : )
> 
> This sounds so intriguing, but I really don't understand it! My 
husband is an electrician. Maybe he'd understand?
> 
> I am someone who is very interested in EVP, but got bored using a 
digital recorder and just recording voices. I wanted more than 
that. I think you guys understand that. I want to know everything 
about it. I want to experiment. When someone mentioned this board 
and I checked it out, I loved what I was reading about all of the 
experimenting and I hope to get involved in it!
> 
> Amy
> SIPS
> 
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: Misty Dawn<mailto:bulletbabea@...> 
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
> Sent: Wednesday, March 21, 2007 10:49 PM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Sweep Tuning of AM Radio Band - FWIW
> 
> 
> 
> Thats kind of you to offer Bill =) Id say me, but I'd need a 
video instruction book to go with it LOL with you going you put this 
thingy into that thingamajigger. Is there welding involved? (I dont 
do it)
> 
> I KNEW I should have played with the older boys building radios 
when I was in school. But I was way too shy then and only in grade 
school so I did crafts with the older girls. Advanced classes were 
interesting but my shyness didnt help. So for the technically 
challenged (like me) perhaps you could lay out a mock instruction 
plan with a pic or two?
> 
> I know quite a few on the group dont need it, and probably 
understand what you are saying completely. 
> 
> Misty
> kenneth b thomas <kennnthomas2000@...> wrote:
> thanks for taking the trouble to look, Bill.
> 
> i have a yahoo messenger webcam set up for members of franks-
evp only 
> for better explanatios/demonstrations. if anyone wants an evp 
> competent (or wtf) 1n34 to plug into their tape machine AND is 
a 
> member of this group only , i'll send them out as long as i can 
> afford it/can spare time. worth the effort IMO for patient 
detail 
> conscious researchers which evp-ers seem to be. the described 
> procedure should work on first or second try for those that can 
put 
> together crystal receiver and plug it into amplifier.--with 
smal cap 
> to ground plug, you could even do it with a tape recorder. all 
long 
> wires that can act as antennas can then be removed and only 
diode or 
> diode and tuned circuit employed. whole assembly can be rotated 
to 
> block out radio stations.
> 
> kthomas
> 
>

lightning 
> between

galactic 
> > > center so april 6 should be best evp time in awhile
> > > 
> > > tonite:
> > > 
> > > 
> > > heated anode gold whisker end with one match . in live 
circuit 
> tuned 
> > > to strong local station.
> > > 
> > > when match was two thirds burned, white noise started. 
match was 
> put 
> > > out. 
> > > 
> > > now there is a steady 20mv* across input with diode in 
place. 
> > > previously 0 mv. no difference when diode is reversed.. 
diode 
> > > removed, v drops to zero. formerly strong local station was 
> barely 
> > > audible with good audio amp. now it is at normal listening 
> volume. 
> > > diode is noisy, but beneath what you can hear when tuned to 
> > > station. "lumpy" white noise; white noise with larger scale 
> order 
> > > appearing and vanishing- unpredictably , like candle flame- 
but 
> > > averaging about 3-15 times per second
> > > 
> > > other am receivers still full of crashing static from long 
gone t-
> > > storm.
> > > 
> > > tank circuit +diode + audio amp= no lightning crashes 
> whatsoever. no 
> > > line noise. no fluorescent light 60hz buzz.
> > > 
> > > Ken Thomas <kennnthomas2000@> wrote:
> > > im making som noise sources as soon as i collapse for 
awhile by 
> > > holding a soldering iron to either end of 1n34 diode in 
live 
> > > circuit. injection of gold from point contact into 
germanium 
> block 
> > > forms defect type dopant and microscopic p or n+ later 
junction 
> which 
> > > has low back threshold and is very noisy but low amplitude. 
> noise 
> > > that issues from an infinitely smal point source seems to 
work 
> better 
> > > for some reason. i just hold a match or soldering on there 
> while 
> > > listening to amplified noise till i get something that 
sounds good
> > > 
> > > * 20mv average, larger scale prigogine fluctuations up to 
75mv. 
> > > unpredictable but not completely random--pinked up due to 
> SOMETHING 
> > > UNIDENTIFIED trying to cohere. amplified 3-15 per second 
voltage 
> > > peaks drive sweep. random except for voice or other 
coherent 
> energy.
